intro: Vigna vexillata f. leiocarpa, commonly known as the white cowpea, is a cultivated variant of the cowpea species native to Africa. It is characterized by its smooth, white pod and seeds, which are typically smaller than those of the common cowpea. The plant is an annual legume that thrives in warm climates and is often grown for its edible seeds. It has a climbing habit and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. This variety is valued for its nutritional content and is commonly used in traditional cuisines across sub-Saharan Africa.
